message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SP, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with compressive sensing and signal processing, which are both core topics in the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Signal Processing (cs.SP) sub-categories. The use of circulant sensing matrices is a specific technique that falls under the Linear Algebra, Matrix Theory (cs.LG) sub-category. The paper also discusses the application of compressive sensing to various signal processing tasks, such as filtering, interpolation, and transforms, which are relevant to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes exact methods for performing these tasks directly in the compressed domain, which involves solving optimization problems, which is a topic in the Numerical Analysis (cs.NA) sub-category.
